meanings.definition: A person or thing that nullifies something.
meanings.sent1: The judge acted as a nullifier in the courtroom, canceling out the previous ruling.
meanings.sent2: The nullifier of the team's winning streak was their lack of practice.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous nullifier, a clever monkey, kept erasing the chalkboard during class.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was a nullifier of any tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's power was a nullifier of all evil in the city.

meanings.definition: A substance that neutralizes the effect of another substance.
meanings.sent1: The antacid acted as a nullifier, soothing the burning sensation in his stomach.
meanings.sent2: The nullifier in the experiment counteracted the acidic solution, bringing balance.
meanings.sent3: The baking soda, a trusty nullifier, saved the day by stopping the vinegar from overflowing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a nullifier, brightening up even the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The sunscreen acted as a nullifier, protecting her skin from the harmful UV rays.
